channel.title: 金融时报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪金融时报news的种子

item.title: 观点：在气候变化和全球贸易路线中断的情况下，茶叶、咖啡和可可供应链正面临压力。这些压力体现了全球化的脆弱性
item.description:
Opinion: Tea, coffee and cocoa supply chains are coming under strain amid climate change and the interruption of global trade routes. The strains are emblematic of the fragility of globalisation https://t.co/L8glCdQ5nR pic.twitter.com/6uw0rOIC6a

— Financial Times (@FT) February 23, 2024

item.title: 剑桥是历史悠久的学院所在地，也是欧洲最大的医学研究中心，近年来经济和人口蓬勃发展。但该市的住房供应却难以跟上步伐。原因就在这里：
item.description:
Cambridge, a place of historic colleges and Europe’s largest medical research centre, has witnessed an economic and population boom in recent years.

But the city’s housing supply is struggling to keep up. Here’s why: https://t.co/vyOKSXFsyq pic.twitter.com/ALMTjFHD0d

— Financial Times (@FT) February 23, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰的冲突和其他地区（包括中东）日益加剧的地缘政治紧张局势，刺激了欧洲大型老牌企业及其供应商的订单量。
item.description:
Ukraine’s conflict and rising geopolitical tensions elsewhere, including in the Middle East, have boosted the order books of large established European companies and their suppliers. https://t.co/49IWFbWdN5 pic.twitter.com/eHpkoyYlGB

— Financial Times (@FT) February 23, 2024

item.title: 在科罗拉多州的一起新颖法律案件中，美国土地所有者起诉阻止石油和天然气公司逃避油井清理责任。200 多万口 "未拔除 "的油井正在泄漏甲烷和其他毒素，给纳税人带来数十亿美元的损失 @FT
item.description:
US landowners sue to block oil and gas companies from walking away from their well clean up liabilities in a novel legal case in Colorado. 2mn+ "unplugged" oil wells are leaking methane and other toxins in a multibillion dollar hit to taxpayers https://t.co/cKZ9S6GoY6 @FT pic.twitter.com/Ikoh7DBACD

— Jamie Smyth (@JamieSmythF) February 23, 2024

item.title: 今天的 @ftmoralmoney 新闻通讯关注 @MIT 和 @clarityai 的新研究。他们发现，设定碳排放目标的公司更有可能减少排放量，但前提是他们的碳排放报告必须经过第三方审计。🚨
item.description:
Today's @ftmoralmoney newsletter looks at new research from @MIT and @clarityai.

They found that companies setting carbon targets were more likely to reduce their emissions — 🚨 but only if they had their carbon reports audited by a third party. 🚨https://t.co/Ih33121sJV

— Simon Mundy (@simonmundy) February 23, 2024

item.title: "日本的估值很有吸引力，股东治理也越来越友好。可能会有更多的整合和并购"。在股市大涨之后，@stuartkirk__ 正在考虑是坚持还是扭转。
item.description:

item.title: 一张图看懂美国住房问题的政治：- 蓝州的民众和政客说他们非常关心住房危机和无家可归者问题，但却不断阻挠住房建设，导致这两个问题越来越严重- 红州只是允许大量新建住房，并不存在住房危机。
item.description:
The politics of America’s housing issues in one chart:

• People and politicians in blue states say they care deeply about the housing crisis and homelessness but keep blocking housing so both get worse

• Red states simply permit loads of new homes and have no housing crisis pic.twitter.com/2A6r0tQSyg

— John Burn-Murdoch (@jburnmurdoch) February 23, 2024

item.title: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）政府希望看到巴勒斯坦权力机构控制加沙，但以色列总理办公室连夜发布的一份一页纸文件却只字未提该权力机构的任何作用，并拒绝接受国际社会为承认巴勒斯坦权力机构而采取的单方面措施。
item.description:
A one-page document, released overnight by the Israeli prime minister’s office, makes no mention of any role for the Palestinian Authority that Joe Biden's administration wants to see take control of Gaza and rejects unilateral international steps towards recognition of a… pic.twitter.com/OweRuf1Xgx

— Financial Times (@FT) February 23, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯展现出了令人惊讶的持续作战能力。西方国家对乌克兰的弹药供应放缓，使得沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基总统面临着对其领导能力的最大考验。
item.description:
Russia has displayed a surprising ability to sustain its war-fighting capacity.

The slowdown in western ammunition supplies to Ukraine leaves President Volodymyr Zelenskyy facing arguably the greatest test yet of his leadership.https://t.co/dGdWRU5drB pic.twitter.com/kb9vXyCu4A

— Financial Times (@FT) February 23, 2024
